description: From convergere, from con- (“together”) + vergere (“to bend”).

verbs.description: converge (third-person singular simple present converges, present participle converging, simple past and past participle converged)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) (said of two or more entities) To approach each other; to get closer and closer.
(intransitive, mathematics) (said of a sequence or series) To have a (finite, proper) limit.
(intransitive, computing) (said of an iterative process) To reach a stable end point.
